oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of channel-confinement and aiding/opposing buoyancy on the two-dimensional laminar flow and heat transfer across a square cylinder
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SHARMA, ATUL
ESWARAN, V
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: buoyancy
channel flow
heat transfer
laminar flow
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The effect of channel-confinement of various degree (blockage ratio of 10%, 30% and 50%) on the upward flow and heat transfer characteristics around a heated/cooled square cylinder is studied by considering the effect of aiding/opposing buoyancy at âˆ’1 less-than-or-equals, slant Ri less-than-or-equals, slant 1, for Re = 100 and Pr=0.7. With increasing blockage ratio, the minimum heating (critical Ri) required for the suppression of vortex shedding decreases up to a certain blockage ratio (=30%), but thereafter increases. The influence of buoyancy and channel-confinement on the recirculation length, drag and lift coefficient, pumping power, Strouhal number and heat transfer from the cylinder, is also investigated.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: International Journal of Heat and Mass Transfer 48(25-26), 5310-5322
